page.title: 19TRANSPORT - CROYDON 1985
page.content: Through our area there are three main "through London" routes;the London Road, Mitcham Road and the Purley Way. The Purley Way serves the Industrial Area. These roads carry vast numbers of lorries and vans carrying raw mater- ials and finished goods from the South Coast to Croydon and the rest of the country. The congestion is not helped by the number of parked cars, as few houses in our area have garages. Most local people use the bus service for getting to the main station and for shopping in Croydon centre. There are eight services running through the area and an "all night" service was introduced a year ago. Many local people find the level of traffic (especially the articulated lorries) too high and find greatest difficulty in crossing even the smallest road, and particularly the Lombard Roundabout.
